name: Our World for Kids Quiz: Which Country am I? | 10 Questions

questions.text: Madrid is my capital. Bull fighting is a sport here. Portugal borders me to the west. Which country am I?
questions.explanation:
Spain.

	Madrid is the largest city in Spain. Other major cities in Spain include Barcelona and Seville. The Atlantic ocean is situated to the west of Spain. People from Spain are called Spanish or Spaniards.

questions.text: My official languages are Dutch, French and German. I share a border with France, Germany and Luxembourg and the Netherlands. Aalst and Dinant are cities in me. Which country am I?
questions.explanation:
Belgium.

	The capital of Belgium is Brussels. Belgium has a population of about 10.7 million people. Belgium loves waffles and french fries. The national dishes are steak and fries with salad and mussels with fries.

questions.text: I am the largest country in Africa. My capital is Algiers. Which country am I?
questions.explanation:
Algeria.

	Algeria is also the tenth largest country in the world in terms of area. It is located in North Africa. It is bordered by Tunisia in the northeast, Libya in the east, Niger in the southeast, Mali and Mauritania in the southwest, Morocco in the northwest and the Mediterranean sea to the north.

questions.text: My capital as well as my largest city is Tehran, and my official language is Persian. Which country am I?
questions.explanation:
Iran.

	It is the 18th largest country in the world in terms of area. There are large reserves of petroleum and natural gas found in Iran. Iran's highest point is Mount Damavand.

questions.text: My name in Japanese is Nippon. I am home to a city called Osaka. The currency used in me is the yen. Which country am I?
questions.explanation:
Japan.

	Japan is also called 'Land of the Rising Sun'. Its capital is Tokyo. Sumo wrestling is the national sport of Japan. Martial arts are also widely practiced in Japan. Golf is also popular in Japan.

questions.text: My largest city is Quezon City, but that is not my capital. I am a part of Asia. My currency is the peso. Which country am I?
questions.explanation:
Philippines.

	Its capital is Manila. The people are called Filipinos. Its motto is "For God, People, Nature and Country". The Philippines is the twelfth most populous country with a population of about 90 million. The national economy is the 46th largest in the world.

questions.text: I am home to the Taj Mahal. My capital is New Delhi. Which country am I?
questions.explanation:
India.

	India has 28 states and 7 union territories. Its most populated cities are Kolkata (previously Calcutta), Chennai, Bangalore and Mumbai/Bombay. It is the seventh largest country by geographical area. The Himalayas are located in north India. Most Indian cities have a 'twin' city in Pakistan.

questions.text: I am located off the coast of India. I was once known as Ceylon. My largest city is Colombo. Which country am I?
questions.explanation:
Sri Lanka.

	The capital of Sri Lanka is Sri Jayawardenapurakotte. Its official languages are Sinhali and Tamil. It is home to about 20 million people now. The national anthem is 'Sri Lanka Matha'.

questions.text: Peru and Bolivia border me. My capital is Santiago. My official language is Spanish. Which country am I?
questions.explanation:
Chile.

	Chile's motto is 'By Right or Might'. The Atacama desert passes through it. Its currency is the peso. The Andes mountains are located on the eastern border of the country. The northern Chilean desert contains many minerals, especially copper.

questions.text: My capital is Wellington. I am located in the southern Pacific Ocean. Which country am I?
questions.explanation:
New Zealand.

	Its largest city is Auckland. New Zealanders are nicknamed 'Kiwis' after a native New Zealand bird. The national rugby team is called the All Blacks.
